items.item_text: 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 40 South Market Street, San Jose, CA 95113
items.item_text_raw: 1. 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 40 South Market Street, San Jose, CA 95113

items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details: The Board  and   San Jose/Evergreen Community College District will receive a framed Commendation from Assemblymember Nora Campos because of its  proactive work in its support of the National Hispanic University and its students as it faced potential closure last year.  In particular, the Assemblymember Campos recognizes the SJECCD Board of Trustees, Chancellor Cepeda and in particular Evergreen Valley College President Yong, Vice President Archuleta and her staff for their leadership to ensure that the TRIO programs and its resources would continue to serve the East San José Community.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. Board Policy 6100 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions exceeding the current bid limit of $86,000 shall have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts, although not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions for the period of December 10, 2014 through January 9, 2015 as noted in the attached documents.
items.item_text: Ratification of Contracts, Purchase Orders and Contract Revisions
items.item_text_raw: 7. Ratification of Contracts, Purchase Orders and Contract Revisions

items.item_details:
On February 11, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved an agreement with Sundt Construction, Inc. for the amount of $87,000 to provide pre-construction services for the Physical Education Building #122 at the San Jose City College campus. 
	 
Revision No. 001 is for value engineering and estimating services beyond the current scope of Sundt Construction Inc.'s pre-construction service agreement.
	 
Sundt Construction, Inc. submitted a proposal for these services that has been reviewed to ensure compliance with their contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                    $   87,000
Previously Approved Changes            $     0,000
Revision No. 001                                 $   15,000
	 
Revised Contract Amount                    $102,000
	 
The net change to Sundt Construction, Inc.'s contract as a result of all changes issued is $15,000 which equates to 17.24% of the original contract.  This change will be funded from project contingency.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Revision No. 001 in the amount of $15,000 to Sundt Construction, Inc. for the Physical Education Building #122 at San Jose City College.
items.item_text: San Jose City College (SJCC), Physical Education Building #122 - Sundt Construction Inc. Revision to Preconstruction Services Agreement No. 001
items.item_text_raw: 2. San Jose City College (SJCC), Physical Education Building #122 - Sundt Construction Inc. Revision to Preconstruction Services Agreement No. 001

items.item_details:
On March 11, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to Kitchell CEM Inc. in the amount of $4,914,192 to provide construction services for the Career Technical Education Project #31107-2, Buildings 100 and 200, at the San Jose City College. 
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions; District requested or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract, scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 006 is for owner directed changes as well as changes resulting from unforeseen conditions.  
	 
Kitchell CEM Inc. submitted written pricing proposals for these changes (details in the attachment) that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount               $4,914,192.00
Previous Approved Changes          $   297,678.93
Change Order No. 006                   $     18,552.88
Total Contract and Changes           $5,230,423.81
	 
The net change to Kitchell CEM Inc. contract as a result of all changes issued is $316,231.81 which equates to 6.4% of the original contract.  This change will be funded from project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 006 in the amount of $18,552.88 to Kitchell CEM Inc., for the Career Technical Education Project #31107-02, Buildings 100 and 200 at San Jose City College.
items.item_text: San Jose City College (SJCC) Career Technical Education Project #31107-2 – Buildings 100 and 200 Change Order No. 006
items.item_text_raw: 3. San Jose City College (SJCC) Career Technical Education Project #31107-2 – Buildings 100 and 200 Change Order No. 006

items.item_details:
On 6/11/2013, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to Premier Builders, Inc. in the amount of $430,705.00 to provide construction services or products for  the Photo Lab Relocation Project #31121 at the SJCC. 
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions; District requested or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract, scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 004 is a deductive change order to credit the District for unfinished punch list items.   
	 
Premier Builders agree to the decrease in retention due to unfinished punch list items.  The amount deducted was reflective of the remaining items.
	 
Original Contract Amount                          $  430,705.00
Previously Approved Changes                  $    30,821.00
Change Order No. 004                              $     (1,600.00)
	 
Revised Contract Amount                          $ 459,926.00
	 
The net change to Premier Builders', Inc. contract as a result of all changes issued is $29,221.00, which equates to 6.8% of the original contract.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 004 in the amount of $(1,600.00) from Premier Builders, Inc., for the Photo Lab Relocation Project #31121.
items.item_text: San Jose City College (SJCC) Photo Lab Relocation Project #31121– Premier Builders, Inc. Change Order No. 004
items.item_text_raw: 4. San Jose City College (SJCC) Photo Lab Relocation Project #31121– Premier Builders, Inc. Change Order No. 004

items.item_details:
On August 26, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved an Agreement to Blach Construction Company in the amount of $41,639,729 to provide construction services for the South Campus Development Project #32107 at Evergreen Valley College.
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions or District request design changes that require an adjustment to the contract scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 004 includes work of adding epoxy flooring to the second floor restrooms of the Math & Science Building, revising the Fitness Center power and data for the fitness equipment, decreasing the level of preparation required for exposed structural steel, modifying the configuration of the Electrical Room equipment, deleting the electric water cooler from the specified drinking fountain, and adding one area drain at ‘Stair C’ landing.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.  
	 
Original Contract Amount                             $41,639,729.00
Previously Approved Changes                     $    (345,816.00)
Change Order No. 004                                 $          2,659.14   
Revised Contract Amount                             $41,296,572.14
	 
The net change to Blach Construction Company’s contract as a result of all changes issued is ($343,156.86), which equates to (0.82%) of the original contract.  This change will be funded from the project contingency established in the project budget.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 004 in the amount of $2,659.14 to Blach Construction Company for the South Campus Development Project #32107 at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College South Campus Development Project #32107 – Blach Construction Company Change Order No. 004
items.item_text_raw: 5. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College South Campus Development Project #32107 – Blach Construction Company Change Order No. 004

items.item_details:
Dasher Technologies was awarded a Project Amendment Authorization on August 26, 2014 to provide network discovery and design services for the new District Office. This design effort resulted in a final network equipment selection and the finalized network design. Developing the network architecture was then undertaken and additional network functionality and features were added to the overall project scope. This Change Order expands the initial PAA discovery and design agreement to capture this full scope. The resulting Change Order adds nearly double the hours that were originally scoped.  ITSS has reviewed the scope and the design effort required and is satisfied with the work of Dasher Technologies and the reasonableness of the hours and cost represented in this Change Order.  
 
Original Contract Amount          $13,950.00
Change Order No. 1                  $22,175.00
Revised Contract Amount          $36,125.00
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a Change Order to Dasher Technologies for additional design services required for the New District Office Discovery and Design as per attached quote for $22,175.00
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Change Order for District Office Network Migration Design Services
items.item_text_raw: 6. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Change Order for District Office Network Migration Design Services

items.item_details:
The Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee, appointed by the Board of Trustees, has a responsibility under the provisions of Proposition 39 to inform the public, review expenditures and present an annual report to the Board of Trustees. 
	 
The web-based Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee’s 2013-2014 Annual Report is presented to the Board of Trustee’s for acceptance by the 2013-2014 Committee Chair, Mr. Jimmy Nguyen. 
	 
This report is available for review using the following web link: 
http://cboc.sjebond.com/AR1314/.  A printable version of this web-based report is also attached.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept through action the Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee’s 2013-2014 Annual Report.

items.item_details: The Board of Trustees adopted the District's operating budget at its meeting on September 9, 2014.  As required by Board Policy 6250, subsequent budget transfers and revisions must be approved by the Board of Trustees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the resolution authorizing the budget transfers and revisions of funds within expenditure accounts, authorizing the appropriation of the receipt of unanticipated revenues in certain programs, and authorizing the reversal of appropriations in certain programs due to the non-receipt of program revenues.
items.item_text: Resolution Number 021015-1 Approving District Budget Transfers and Revisions
items.item_text_raw: 2. Resolution Number 021015-1 Approving District Budget Transfers and Revisions

items.item_details: On January 30, 2015, President Obama issued a Presidential Proclamation proclaiming February 2015 as National African American History Month. In support of this proclamation and in celebration of the achievements of African American faculty, administrators, staff and students, Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College organized many events in which African American history and culture were celebrated. It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 021015-2 in support of February 2015 as Black/African American History Month.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 021015-2 in support of February 2015 as Black/African American History Month.
items.item_text: Resolution No. 021015-2 in Support of February 2015 as Black/African American History Month
items.item_text_raw: 3. Resolution No. 021015-2 in Support of February 2015 as Black/African American History Month

items.item_details:
The District and Federation of Teachers, AFT 6157 have completed negotiations for 2014-2015. AFT 6157 ratified the tentative agreements on February 6, 2015, for Articles 1, 9, 10, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 22, 24, 31, 32, Appendices A, E, E-A, F, G, H, K, and Side Letter of Agreement .
	 
Effective July 1, 2014 Salary Schedule Increase as follows:
	 
4.5% increase to salary schedules C-1, C-2, D-1, D-2, D-3, D-4, and D-5
	 
Appendix D-1
An additional step is to be added to extend the Adjunct Lecture Salary Schedule to nine (9) steps.  This will be subject to the 4.5% increase. 
	 
Appendix D-2
An additional step is to be added to extend the Adjunct Lab Salary Schedule to nine (9) steps.  This will be subject to the 4.5% increase. 
	 
Increase the load value for all science labs from .15 to .16.
	 
Side Letter of Agreement: Postponement of Science Lab Load Increase
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the District and Federation of Teachers, AFT 6157 tentative agreements.

items.item_details:
On July 8, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a consulting agreement with L. Luster & Associates (LLA) with the expectation to improve upon data collection and reporting, and achieve tangible, measurable increases, in participation with minority owned, women owned and small businesses.     
	 
At the November 11, 2014 Board of Trustees meeting, LLA presented a report from the first quarter of their consulting services effort.
	 
This second update presentation by LLA consultants will focus on the data collected to date and reporting metrics to be used to monitor progress in this outreach initiative.
items.item_text: Diverse Business Outreach - Quarterly Update
items.item_text_raw: 2. Diverse Business Outreach - Quarterly Update

items.item_details:
On May 14, 2013 the Board approved the Design-Build delivery method for the Milpitas Joint-Use 21st Century Post-Secondary Education Center, #309. 
	 
On August 26, 2014 the Board approved an Agreement to McCarthy Building Companies Inc. / Steinberg Architects to provide Design-Build Services for the Milpitas Joint-Use 21st Century Post-Secondary Education Center, #309.
	 
The project is currently on schedule to begin construction in Fall 2015 and complete in Fall 2016.
	 
This presentation is to provide a general project update to the Board.

items.item_details:
Per its adopted governing principles, the Board of Trustees will evaluate its performance at the end of each meeting.
	 
The Board will consider two items in discussing its evaluation:
	 
1.To ascertain the effectiveness of the meeting in attaining the advancement of the Board's Global Ends Policy.
	 
2.To ascertain the degree to which Trustees adhered to the Board adopted Governance Principle: Trustees Code of Conduct.
